Ann Noreen Widdecombe,post-nominalsGBR100%DSG(born 4 October 1947) is a former BritishConservative Party (UK)Conservative Partypolitician and has been a novelist since 2000. She is aPrivy Council of the United KingdomPrivy Councillorand was the Member of Parliament forMaidstone (UK Parliament constituency)Maidstonefrom 1987 to 1997 and forMaidstone and The Weald (UK Parliament constituency)Maidstone and The Wealdfrom 1997 to 2010. She was asocial conservativeand a member of theConservative Christian Fellowship. She retired from politics at theUnited Kingdom general election, 20102010 general election. Since 2002 she has also made numerous television and radio appearances, including as a television presenter. She is a convert fromAnglicanismto Roman Catholicism.

As an MP, Widdecombe was known for opposing the legality of abortion, her opposition to various issues ofLGBTequality such as an equalage of consentand the repeal ofSection 28, her support for the re-introduction of thedeath penalty, the retention of blasphemy laws and her opposition tofox hunting.
article.heading: Early life
article.paragraph: File:BirminghamUniversityChancellorsCourt.jpgthumb150pxleftTheUniversity of Birmingham, where Ann Widdecombe readLatinBorn inBath, Somerset, Widdecombe is the daughter of Rita Noreen (ne Plummer; 1911-2007) andMinistry of Defence (United Kingdom)Ministry of Defencecivil servant James Murray Widdecombe. Widdecombe's maternal grandfather, James Henry Plummer, was born to anIrish Catholicfamily of English descent inCrosshaven,County Corkin 1874. She attended the Royal Naval School inSingapore,Ann Widdecombe set to stand down;BBC News, 7 October 2007and La Sainte UnionConventSchool in Bath.cite webhttp://www.annwiddecombe.com/text.aspx?idAbout Annannwiddecombe.com8 October 2009She then readLatinat theUniversity of Birminghamand later attendedLady Margaret Hall, Oxford, to readPhilosophy, Politics and Economics(PPE).cite webhttp://www.lmh.ox.ac.uk/Alumni/Prominent-alumni.aspxLMH, Oxford - Prominent Alumni20 May 2015She worked forUnilever(197375) and then as an administrator at theUniversity of London(197587) before entering Parliament.

article.paragraph: From 1976 to 1978, Widdecombe was acouncilloronRunnymede (borough)Runnymede DistrictCouncil in Surrey.cite newshttp://www.guardian.co.uk/politics/2003/nov/03/uk.conservativeshttp://www.guardian.co.uk/politics/2003/nov/03/uk.conservatives3 November 2003[[The Guardian]]London6 December 2008JackieAshleyShe contested the seat ofBurnley (UK Parliament constituency)Burnleyin Lancashire in theUnited Kingdom general election, 19791979 general electionand then, againstDavid Owen, thePlymouth Devonport (UK Parliament constituency)Plymouth Devonportseat in theUnited Kingdom general election, 19831983 general election.cite webhttp://www.psr.keele.ac.uk/area/uk/ge79/i04.htmUK General Election results May 19793 May 1979Political Science ResourcesRichard Kimberhttp://web.archive.org/web/20060925040210/http://www.psr.keele.ac.uk/area/uk/ge79/i04.htm25 September 200616 November 2008cite webhttp://www.psr.keele.ac.uk/area/uk/ge83/i16.htmUK General Election results June 19839 June 1983Political Science ResourcesRichard Kimberhttp://web.archive.org/web/20080320065802/http://www.psr.keele.ac.uk/area/uk/ge83/i16.htm20 March 200816 November 2008
article.heading: Member of Parliament
article.paragraph: She was first elected to theHouse of Commons of the United KingdomHouse of Commonsin theUnited Kingdom general election, 19871987 general electionas member for the constituency ofMaidstone (UK Parliament constituency)Maidstone(which becameMaidstone and The Weald (UK Parliament constituency)Maidstone and The Wealdin 1997).Maidstone and The Weald, UKPollingReport
article.heading: Political views
article.paragraph: As an MP, Widdecombe expressed conservative views, including opposition to abortion; it was understood during her time in frontline politics that she would not becomeSecretary of State for HealthHealth Secretaryas long as this involved responsibility for abortions. Although a committed Christian, she has characterised the issue as one of life and death on which her view had been the same when she was agnostic.cite newshttp://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk_politics/280692.stmBBC NewsAnn Widdecombe answers your questions16 February 199930 April 2010Along withJohn GummerMP, she converted from theChurch of Englandto the Catholic Church following the decision of the Church of England on theOrdination of womenas priests.cite newshttp://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk_politics/112152.stmBBC NewsWiddecombe rejects abortion role13 June 199825 April 2010In her speech at the 2000 Conservative conference, she called for azero tolerancepolicy of prosecution, with the punishment of 100Pound sterlingGBPfines for users ofcannabis (drug)cannabis. This was well received by rank-and-file Conservative delegates.cite newshttp://www.guardian.co.uk/politics/2000/oct/06/drugsandalcohol.conservatives2000Widdecombe fights back firmWattNicholas6 October 2000The GuardianLondon22 August 2009

Widdecombe consistently opposedLGBTequality. On the issue of an equal age of consent, she said in 2000: "I do not believe that issues of equality should override the imperatives of protecting the young."cite newshttp://www.theguardian.com/politics/2000/feb/11/uk.politicalnews1Commons approves bill to lower gay age of consentThe GuardianLondon11 February 20002 June 2015In 2003, Widdecombe proposed an amendment opposing repeal ofSection 28of theLocal Government Act 1988Local Government Act, which banned the promotion of homosexuality by local governments. Out of the 17 parliamentary votes considered by thePublic Whipwebsite to concern equal rights for homosexuals, Widdecombe took the opposing position in 15 cases, not being present at the other two votes."Ann Widdecombe compared to 'Homosexuality  Equal rights'",Public Whip. Retrieved on 24 June 2009.Widdecombe has also expressed her opposition toSame-sex marriage in the United Kingdomsame-sex marriage, introduced byDavid Cameron's government in 2014, claiming that "the state must have a preferred model" and "a union that is generally open to procreation".cite newshttp://www.theguardian.com/politics/2013/jun/06/ann-widdecombe-david-cameron-listen-peopleAnn Widdecombe: 'I wish David Cameron would listen to people'The GuardianLondonStephenMoss6 June 20138 Feb 2014

She is a committed animal lover and one of the few Conservative MPs to have consistently voted for the ban onfox hunting."Ann Widdecombe compared to 'Fox hunting  Ban'",Public Whip. Retrieved on 21 March 2009.Widdecombe was among more than 20 high-profile people who signed a letter to Members of Parliament in 2015 to oppose David Cameron's plan to amend theHunting Act 2004.cite newshttp://news.stv.tv/scotland-decides/news/1324609-snp-to-vote-against-tories-on-fox-hunting-ban-in-england-and-wales/SNP to vote against Tories on fox hunting ban in England and WalesSTV13 July 201517 July 2015

She has expressed a variety of views on scientific issues such asclimate changebut has been opposed to legislation reducing emissions. Her views on the subject appear to have hardened over time. In 2007, she wrote that she did not want to belittle the issue but was sceptical of the claims that specific actions would prevent catastrophe,cite webhttp://www.express.co.uk/posts/view/2489/Switching-lightbulbs-won-t-save-the-worldSwitching Lightbulbs won't change the worldExpress.co.uk21 March 200726 August 2011then in 2008 that her doubts had been "crystalised" by Nigel Lawson's bookAn Appeal to Reason,cite webhttp://www.express.co.uk/ourcomments/view/48856Yes, I am a heretic on global warmingExpress.co.uk18 June 200826 August 2011before stating in 2009 that "There is no climate change, hasnt anybody looked out of their window recently?"cite webhttp://www.express.co.uk/posts/view/79580/Now-the-EU-wants-to-ban-your-plasma-televisionArticle including refutation of any global warmingExpress.co.uk12 January 200926 August 2011She was one of the five MPs who voted against theClimate Change Act 2008.cite webhttp://www.publicwhip.org.uk/division.php?dateClimate Change Bill â€” Third Reading (and other amendments)28 October 2008The Public Whip31 October 2014In 2011 she expressed the view that "climate change money should go to armed services".cite webhttp://www.express.co.uk/ourcomments/view/262765Climate change money should go to armed services[[Daily Express]]20119 October 2012The previous year, she voted to support a parliamentary motion supportinghomeopathy, criticizing the Science and Technology Committee's Report on the subject.cite webhttp://www.parliament.uk/edm/2009-10/908UK Parliament Early day motion 908http://www.parliament.uk/23 February 201010 August 2015

Over the years, Widdecombe has expressed her support for a reintroduction of the death penalty, which was abolished in the UK in 1965. She notably spoke of her support for its reintroduction for the worst cases of murder in the aftermath of the murder of two 10-year-old girls fromSoham, Cambridgeshire, in August 2002, in theSoham murders. She supported the argument that the death penalty would have deterrent value, as within five years of its abolition the national murder rate had more than doubled.cite newshttp://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk_politics/2204738.stmUK | Politics | Death penalty call renewedBBC News21 August 200226 August 2011
article.heading: In government
article.paragraph: Widdecombe joinedJohn Major's government asParliamentary Under-Secretary of Statefor Social Security in 1990. In 1993, she was moved to theDepartment of Employment, and she was promoted toMinister of Statethe following year. In 1995, she joined theHome Officeas Minister of State for Prisons and visited every prison in Britain.cite newshttp://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk_politics/talking_politics/104160.stmAnn Widdecombe â€“ political sketchBBC Online17 June 20092 June 1998London
article.heading: Shadow Cabinet
article.paragraph: After the fall of the Conservative government toLabour Party (UK)Labourin 1997, she served asShadow Secretary of State for HealthShadow Health Secretarybetween 1998 and 1999 and later asShadow Home Secretarybetween 1999 and 2001 underWilliam Hague.cite newshttp://www.guardian.co.uk/politics/person/5516/ann-widdecombeAnn Widdecombe: Electoral history and profileThe GuardianLondon22 August 2009
article.heading: Leadership contest and backbenches
article.paragraph: During theConservative Party (UK) leadership election, 20012001 Conservative leadership election, she could not find sufficient support amongst Conservative MPs for her leadership candidacy. She first supportedMichael Ancram, who was eliminated in the first round, and thenKenneth Clarke, who lost in the final round. She afterwards declined to serve inShadow Cabinet of Iain Duncan SmithIain Duncan Smith's Shadow Cabinet(although she indicated on the television programmeWhen Louis Met..., prior to the leadership contest, that she wished to retire to thebackbenchesanyway).

In theConservative Party (UK) leadership election, 20052005 leadership election, she initially supported Kenneth Clarke again. Once he was eliminated, she turned support towardsLiam Fox. Following Fox's subsequent elimination, she took time to reflect before finally declaring forDavid Davis (British politician)David Davis. She expressed reservations over the eventual winnerDavid Cameron, feeling that he did not, like the other candidates, have a proven track record, and she was later a leading figure in parliamentary opposition to his A-List policy, which she has said is "an insult to women".cite newshttp://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-1221684/David-Cameron-risks-fury-Tory-grass-roots-plans-women-shortlists.htmlCameron cuties: Tory anger as leader calls for all-women MP shortlistsDaily MailLondonJasonGroves21 October 2009At the October 2006 Conservative Conference, she was Chief Dragon in a political version of the television programmeDragons' Den, in which A-list candidates were invited to put forward a policy proposal, which was then torn apart by her team ofRachel Elnaugh,Oliver LetwinandMichael Brown (UK politician)Michael Brown.cite newsIain Dalehttp://commentisfree.guardian.co.uk/iain_dale/2006/10/when_youve_got_nothing_to_writ.htmlTaking the media beast to the dragon's den at guardian.co.ukCommentisfree.guardian.co.uk26 August 2011London3 October 2006

In an interview withMetro (Associated Metro Limited)Metroin September 2006 she stated that if Parliament were of a normal length, it was likely she would retire at the next general election.cite newsAndrew Williams60 Seconds: Ann Widdecombehttp://www.metro.co.uk/fame/interviews/article.html?in_article_id[[Metro (Associated Metro Limited)|Metro]]11 September 20066 September 2007http://web.archive.org/web/20070926225229/http://www.metro.co.uk/fame/interviews/article.html?in_article_id26 September 2007noShe confirmed her intention to stand down toThe Observer's Pendennis diary in September 2007,cite newsOliver MarreWiddy knows the way to a man's hearthttp://observer.guardian.co.uk/7days/story/0,,2160786,00.htmlThe ObserverLondon2 September 20077 October 2007and again in October 2007 after Prime MinisterGordon Brownquashed speculation of an autumn 2007 general election.cite newshttp://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk/7032992.stmBBC NewsAnn Widdecombe set to stand down8 October 200725 April 2010

Widdecombe was one of the 98 MPs who voted to keep their expense details secret.cite newshttp://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/politics/article1816072.eceThe TimesLondonHow your MP voted on the FOI Bill20 May 200725 April 2010PhilippeNaughtonMilesCostelloWhen the expenses claims wereUnited Kingdom Parliamentary expenses scandalleaked, however, Widdecombe was described byThe Daily Telegraphas one of the "saints" amongst all MPs.cite newsMPs' expenses: The saints (Part i)The Daily TelegraphLondonhttp://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/newstopics/mps-expenses/5342811/MPs-expenses-The-saints-Part-i.html?image21 June 200918 May 2009http://web.archive.org/web/20090521124714/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/newstopics/mps-expenses/5342811/MPs-expenses-The-saints-Part-i.html?image21 May 2009no

In May 2009, following the resignation ofMichael Martin, Baron Martin of SpringburnMichael MartinasSpeaker of the British House of CommonsSpeaker of the House of Commons, it was reported that Widdecombe was gathering support for election as interim Speaker until the next general election.cite newsSpeaker: Runners and ridershttp://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk_politics/8057450.stmBBC21 May 200921 May 2009Londonhttp://web.archive.org/web/20090521094143/http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk_politics/8057450.stm21 May 2009noOn 11 June 2009, she confirmed her bid to be the Speaker.cite newshttp://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk_politics/8094377.stmBBC NewsAnn Widdecombe seeks Speaker role11 June 200925 April 2010She made it through to the second ballot but came last and was eliminated.cite newshttp://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk_politics/8111887.stmTwo left in Commons Speaker race22 June 200922 June 2009BBC onlineLondonhttp://web.archive.org/web/20090622191726/http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk_politics/8111887.stm22 June 2009no

Widdecombe retired from politics at theUnited Kingdom general election, 20102010 general election. It was rumoured that she would be a Conservative candidate forPolice and Crime Commissionerin 2012, but she refused. She has since spoken about her opposition to the Coalition Government and her surprise at not being given a peerage byDavid Cameron.cite newshttp://blogs.independent.co.uk/2012/04/15/ann-widdecombe-on-hating-the-coalition-doing-big-brother-and-her-rude-autobiography/Ann Widdecombe on hating the coalition, doing Big Brother and her rude autobiographyindependent.co.ukLondonMattChorley
article.heading: Recognition
article.paragraph: Widdecombe was appointed anHonorary FellowofCanterbury Christ Church Universityat a ceremony held atCanterbury Cathedralon 30 January 2009.cite webWiddecombe, Holland and Underwood are appointed honorary fellows [[Canterbury Christ Church University]] 3 February 2009 http://www.canterbury.ac.uk/News/newsRelease.asp?newsPk19 August 2009
article.heading: Personal life and family
article.paragraph: Until her retirement at theUnited Kingdom general election, 20102010 general election, Widdecombe divided her time between her two homes  one in London and one in the village ofSutton Valence, Kent, in her constituency.cite webhttp://www.fantasticfiction.co.uk/w/ann-widdecombeAnn Widdecombe atFantasticfiction.co.uk26 August 2011She sold both of these properties, however, upon deciding to retire at the next general election.cite newshttp://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/programmes/politics_show/regions/south_east/8288134.stmAn interview with Ann WiddecombeWhartonCraig2 October 2009The Politics ShowBBC8 October 2009Londoncite newshttp://www.telegraph.co.uk/property/retirementproperty/3361350/Division-bell-rings-for-retiring-Ann-Widdecombe.htmlLondonThe Daily TelegraphDivision bell rings for retiring Ann WiddecombeNicolaVenning21 May 2008She shared her home in London with her widowed mother, Rita Widdecombe, until Rita's death, on 25 April 2007, aged 95.Conservative MP's mother dies, aged 95. Retrieved from http://www.kentnews.co.uk/kent-news/Conservative-MP_s-mother-dies,-aged-95-newsinkent3663.aspx.In March 2008, she purchased a house inHaytor, onDartmoorin Devon, to where she has now retired.cite webhttp://www.bbc.co.uk/devon/content/articles/2008/08/06/ann_widdecombe_feature.shtmlWiddecombe moves to Haytor atBBC26 August 2011Her brother, Malcolm (19372010), who was anAnglicanCanon (priest)Canonin Bristol, retired in May 2009 and died ofmetastasismetastaticoesophageal canceron 12 October 2010.cite webhttp://www.pipnjay.org/people/history/341-tribute-to-malcolm-widdecombeTributes to Malcolm WiddecombePipnjay.org13 April 201126 August 2011yeshttps://web.archive.org/20110809231624/http://www.pipnjay.org/people/history/341-tribute-to-malcolm-widdecombe9 August 2011Her nephew, Rev Roger Widdecombe, is an Anglican priest.cite webhttp://www.annwiddecombe.com/issueshow.aspx?idThanksgiving Service atAnnwiddecombe.com26 August 2011

She has never married nor had any children. In November 2007 onBBC Radio 4she described how a journalist once produced a profile on her with the assumption that she had had at least "one sexual relationship", to which Widdecombe replied: "Be careful, that's the way you get sued". When interviewerJenni Murrayasked if she had ever had a sexual relationship, Widdecombe laughed "it's nobody else's business".cite webhttp://www.bbc.co.uk/radio4/womanshour/02/2007_45_tue.shtmlAnn Widdecombe on BBC "Woman's Hour" atBBC26 August 2011

Widdecombe has a fondness for cats and has a section of her website devoted to all the pet cats with which she has shared her life.http://www.annwiddecombe.com/text.aspx?id=57In a recent interview, Widdecombe talked about her appreciation of music despite describing herself as "pretty well tone-deaf".cite newshttp://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-14161671BBC NewsFive Minutes With: Ann Widdecombe16 July 2011cite newshttp://www.guardian.co.uk/politics/2005/apr/15/election20051LondonThe GuardianWillHodgkinsonAnn Widdecombe15 April 2005
article.heading: Religious views
article.paragraph: Widdecombe is a practisingCatholic ChurchCatholic. She converted in 1993 after leaving theChurch of England.cite newshttp://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk/7157409.stmTony Blair joins catholic churchbbconline17 June 200922 December 2007LondonHer reasons for leaving the latter were many, as she explained to reporters from theNew Statesman:

list.listitem: I left the Church of England because there was a huge bundle of straw. The ordination of women was the last straw, but it was only one of many. For years I had been disillusioned by the Church of England's compromising on everything. The Catholic Church doesn't care if something is unpopular.cite webhttp://www.newstatesman.com/religion/2010/07/catholic-church-religiousAnn Widdecombe â€“ extended interview by Alyssa McDonaldNew StatesmanUK19 July 201028 October 2010

article.paragraph: In 2010, Widdecombe turned down an offer to be Britain's next ambassador to theHoly See, being prevented from accepting by suffering adetached retina.cite webCramptonCarolineAnn Widdecombe rules out Vatican appointmenthttp://www.newstatesman.com/blogs/the-staggers/2010/07/detached-retina-post-vaticanThe New Statesman16 December 2012She was made a Dame of theOrder of St. Gregory the GreatbyPope Benedict XVIfor services to politics and public life on 31 January 2013.cite newshttp://www.indcatholicnews.com/news.php?viewStoryAnn Widdecombe awarded papal honourIndependent Catholic News31 January 20132 February 2013
article.heading: Controversies
article.paragraph: In 1990, following the assassination of the Conservative politicianIan Gowby theProvisional Irish Republican Army(IRA), theEastbourne by-election, 1990Eastbourne by-electionfor his seat in theHouse of Commons of the United KingdomHouse of Commonswas won by theLiberal DemocratsLiberal DemocratDavid Bellotti. Upon the announcement, Widdecombe told the voters that the IRA would be "toasting their success".cite newshttp://www.guardian.co.uk/politics/2001/mar/20/profiles.parliament16The GuardianLondonAnn Widdecombe20 March 200125 April 2010AndrewRoth

In 1996, Widdecombe, as prisons minister, defended the Government's policy toUse of restraints on pregnant womenshackle pregnant prisonerswith handcuffs and chains when in hospital receiving ante-natal care. Widdecombe told the Commons the restrictions were needed to prevent prisoners from escaping. "Some MPs may like to think that a pregnant woman would not or could not escape. Unfortunately this is not true. The fact is that hospitals are not secure places in which to keep prisoners, and since 1990, 20 women have escaped from hospitals".Jack Straw, Labour's Home Affairs spokesman at the time, said it was "degrading and unnecessary" for a woman to be shackled at any stage .cite newshttp://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/chaining-women-backed-1323238.htmlChaining women backedThe IndependentLondon10 January 199620 October 2010http://web.archive.org/web/20101012143641/http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/chaining-women-backed-1323238.html12 October 2010nocite newshttp://www.guardian.co.uk/books/2000/mar/18/fiction1Hague's head girlThe GuardianLondon18 March 200020 October 2010http://web.archive.org/web/20100916011112/http://www.guardian.co.uk/books/2000/mar/18/fiction116 September 2010no

In 1997, during the Conservative leadership election ofWilliam Hague, Widdecombe spoke out againstMichael Howard, under whom she had served when he was Home Secretary. She remarked that "there is something of the night about him". The remark was considered to be extremely damaging to Howard, who was frequently satirised as avampirethereafter.cite newshttp://www.guardian.co.uk/cartoons/stevebell/0,7371,1319967,00.htmlSteve Bell cartoon at guardian.co.ukGuardianUK26 August 2011He came last in the poll. Howard went on to become party leader in 2003, however, and Widdecombe then stated, "I explained fully what my objections were in 1997 and I do not retract anything I said then. But this is 2005 and we have to look to the future and not the past."cite newshttp://www.dailymail.co.uk/pages/live/articles/webchats/webchat.html?in_page_idLive chat with Tory Ann Widdecombe atDaily MailUK10 October 200226 August 2011

In 2001, whenMichael Portillowas running for leader of the Conservative Party, Widdecombe described him and his allies as "backbiters". She went on to say that, should he be appointed leader, she would never give him her allegiance.
article.heading: Media work and appearances
article.paragraph: File:Ann Widdecombe.jpgrightthumbWiddecombe in 2006.In 2002, she took part in the ITV programmeCelebrity Fit Club (UK TV series)Celebrity Fit Club. Also in 2002 she took part in aLouis Therouxtelevision documentary, depicting her life, both in and out of politics.cite newshttp://www.independent.co.uk/news/people/profiles/ann-widdecombe-the-truth-about-me-and-louis-theroux-659429.html Ann Widdecombe: The truth about me and Louis TherouxThe IndependentLondon5 March 200211 June 2010http://web.archive.org/web/20100517063321/http://www.independent.co.uk/news/people/profiles/ann-widdecombe-the-truth-about-me-and-louis-theroux-659429.html17 May 2010noIn March 2004 she briefly becameThe Guardiannewspaper'sagony aunt, introduced with anEmma Brockesinterview.cite newsEmma Brockeshttp://www.guardian.co.uk/g2/story/0,3604,1179972,00.html'What a stupid question' at guardian.co.ukGuardianUK26 August 201129 March 2004In 2005BBC Twoshowed six episodes ofThe Widdecombe Project, an agony aunt television programme.In 2005, she appeared in a new series ofCelebrity Fit Club, but this time as a panel member dispensing wisdom and advice to the celebrities taking part.cite newshttp://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/tv_and_radio/3558378.stmMP Widdecombe is BBC agony auntBBC21 November 201012 August 2004Also in 2005, she presented the showAnn Widdecombe to the Rescuein which she acted as an agony aunt, dispensing no-nonsense advice to disputing families, couples, and others across the UK.cite newshttp://www.independent.co.uk/news/people/profiles/ann-widdecombe-mp--an-unlikely-agony-aunt-754932.htmlAnn Widdecombe MP: an unlikely agony aunt28 June 2005The IndependentLondon22 August 2009yeshttps://web.archive.org/20150227005100/http://www.independent.co.uk/news/people/profiles/ann-widdecombe-mp--an-unlikely-agony-aunt-754932.html27 February 2015In 2005, she also appeared in a discussion programme onChannel 5 (UK)Fiveto discuss who had been England's greatest monarch since theNorman Conquest; her choice of monarch wasCharles II of EnglandCharles II.cite webhttp://www.newstatesman.com/200407120003Diary â€“ Jenni BondBondJenni12 July 2004New StatesmanUK22 August 2009yeshttps://web.archive.org/20110607074724/http://www.newstatesman.com/2004071200037 June 2011

She was the guest host of news quizHave I Got News for Youtwice, in 2006 and 2007. Following her second appearance, Widdecombe vowed she would never appear on the show again because of comments made by panellistJimmy Carr. She wrote, "His idea of wit is a barrage of filth and the sort of humour most men grow out of in their teens.... [T]here's no amount of money for which I would go through those two recording hours again. At one stage I nearly walked out."Ann Widdecombe in theDaily Express, as quoted bycite newsWiddecombe disgusted by Carr's 'filth'http://blogs.guardian.co.uk/mediamonkey/2007/11/widdecombe_disgusted_by_carrs.htmlThe GuardianLondon28 November 200730 November 2007http://web.archive.org/web/20071201081438/http://blogs.guardian.co.uk/mediamonkey/2007/11/widdecombe_disgusted_by_carrs.html1 December 2007noShe did, however, stand by her appraisal of regular panellistsIan HislopandPaul Merton, whom she has called "the fastest wits in showbusiness".

In 2007, she awarded theUniversity Challengetrophy to the winners.cite webhttp://www.ukgameshows.com/ukgs/University_ChallengeUniversity ChallengeUK Game Shows.com22 August 2009In the same year, she was cast as herself in "The Sound of Drums (Doctor Who)The Sound of Drums", the 12th episode of the third series of the science-fiction dramaDoctor WhosupportingMr Saxon, the alias ofMaster (Doctor Who)the Master.cite webPeter Warehttp://www.bbc.co.uk/doctorwho/episodes/2007/facts/fact_312.shtmlDoctor Who â€“ Fact File â€“ "The Sound of Drums"Doctor Who: the official siteBBC30 November 2007http://web.archive.org/web/20071017034012/http://www.bbc.co.uk/doctorwho/episodes/2007/facts/fact_312.shtml17 October 2007no

Since 2007, Widdecombe has fronted a televisionTelevision seasonseriescalledAnn Widdecombe Versus, onITV1, in which she speaks to various people about things related to her as anMember of ParliamentMP, with an emphasis on confronting those responsible for problems she wished to tackle. On 15 August 2007 she talked about prostitution, the next week aboutSocial welfare provisionbenefitsand the week after that abouttruancy. A fourth episode was screened on 18 September 2008 in which she travelled around London andBirminghamtalking to girl gangs.cite newshttp://entertainment.timesonline.co.uk/tol/arts_and_entertainment/tv_and_radio/article4781758.eceAnn Widdecombe Versus Girl Gangs; No Heroics; Hollyoaks at timesonline.co.uk1 September 2011LondonThe Times19 September 2008PhilippeNaughtonMilesCostello

In 2009, Widdecombe appeared with ArchbishopJohn Onaiyekanin an "Intelligence Squared" debate in which they defended the motion that the Catholic Church was a force for good. Arguing against the motion wereStephen FryandChristopher Hitchens.Cite newshttp://archive.catholicherald.co.uk/article/23rd-october-2009/1/atheist-duo-convince-crowd-that-the-church-is-not-Atheist duo convince crowd that the Church is not a force for goodEd WestThe Catholic Herald18 February 2012London23 October 2009yeshttps://web.archive.org/20120626053333/http://archive.catholicherald.co.uk:80/article/23rd-october-2009/1/atheist-duo-convince-crowd-that-the-church-is-not-26 June 2012

In October 2010, she appeared onBBC One'sStrictly Come Dancing, partnered byAnton du Beke, winning the support of some viewers despite low marks from the judges.cite webhttp://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episode/b00v7qxs/Strictly_Come_Dancing_Series_8_Week_1_Show_2/Strictly Come Dancing atBBC2 October 201026 August 2011cite newsGriceElizabethhttp://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/tvandradio/strictly-come-dancing/8076273/Interview-with-Ann-Widdecombe.htmlInterview with Ann Widdecombe at www.telegraph.co.ukThe Daily TelegraphUK26 August 201121 October 2010After nine weeks of routines strongly flavoured by comedy the couple had received enough support in the public vote to stay in the contest. Widdecombe was eliminated from the competition on Sunday 5 December after the public vote had been combined with the judges' score; she was withScott MaslenofEastEndersin the bottom two.

Widdecombe is currently filming a new quiz show with herself as questionmaster, for theSky Atlanticchannel, calledCleverdicks. The show is being shown in 30 one-hour episodes in an initial series, starting 2012. It features four contestants, usually high quality members of the UK national quiz circuit and ends with a money round for the winner of each show.cite webhttp://www.express.co.uk/posts/view/277070/Ann-Widdecombe-to-host-new-TV-quiz-showAnn Widdecombe to host new TV quiz showExpress.co.uk

On 23 April 2012 Widdecombe presented an hour-long documentary forBBC Radio 5 Live,Drunk Again: Ann Widdecombe Investigates, looking at how the British attitude to getting drunk has changed over the last few years.cite webhttp://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b01ghshjDrunk Again: Anne Widdecombe InvestigatesBBC23 April 201223 April 2012

It was revealed in October 2012, that the year'sChildren in Need's appeal night will feature aStrictly Come Dancingspecial with former show favouritesRussell Grantand Ann Widdecombe.cite webAlexFletcherhttp://www.digitalspy.co.uk/tv/s104/strictly-come-dancing/news/a434358/russell-grant-widdecombe-return-to-strictly-for-children-in-need.htmlRussell Grant, Widdecombe return to 'Strictly' for Children in Needdigitalspy.co.uk30 October 20122 November 2012

On 4 November 2012, Ann presented guest hosted one episode of BBC'sSongs of Praiseprogramme about singleness.cite webhttp://www.thisisstaffordshire.co.uk/Ann-s-happy-Strictly-singleton/story-17236462-detail/story.htmlAnn's happy to be Strictly a singletonthisisstaffordshire.co.uk5 November 20125 November 2012

In October 2014 she appeared in the BBC seriesAntiques Road TripCelebrity Antiques Road Trip, partnered with expertMark Stacey, where the pair beat the rival team ofCraig Revel Horwoodand Catherine Southon.cite webhttp://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b016nbj8BBC Two - Celebrity Antiques Road Trip, Series 1, Episode 1BBC
article.heading: Stage acting career
article.paragraph: Following her retirement, Widdecombe made her stage debut, on 9 December 2011, at The Orchard Theatre,Dartfordin the Christmas pantomimeSnow White and the Seven Dwarfs, alongsideStrictly Come DancingjudgeCraig Revel Horwood.cite newshttp://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-kent-12626500Ann Widdecombe to star in panto in DartfordBBC NewsIn April 2012, she had a ten-minute non-singing cameo part inGaetano Donizetti's comic operaLa Fille Du Regiment, playing Duchesse de Crackentorp.cite newshttp://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-17783927Ann Widdecombe makes opera debutBBC NewsAnn reprised her pantomime performance, again with Revel Horwood, at The Swan Theatre,High Wycombein December 2012.cite webhttps://wycombeswan.co.uk/Online/default.asp?doWork::WScontent::loadArticleHQ Theatreswycombeswan.co.uk
article.heading: Other interests
article.paragraph: Her non-political accomplishments include being a popular novelist. Widdecombe also currently writes a weekly column for theDaily Express.cite webhttp://express.co.uk/search/Ann%20Widdecombe/1/created/40Home of the Daily and Sunday Express | Keyword search for Ann Widdecombe :: Page 1 | Breaking news, sport, showbiz, pictures and video from the Daily and SundaExpress.co.uk26 August 2011http://web.archive.org/web/20110727024626/http://www.express.co.uk/search/Ann%20Widdecombe/1/created/4027 July 2011no

In October 2006, she pledged to boycottBritish Airwaysfor suspending a worker who refused to hide herChristian crosscross. The matter was resolved when the company reversed the suspension.cite webhttp://www.metro.co.uk/news/article.html?in_article_idWiddecombe pledges to boycott BA15 October 2006Metro22 August 2009In November 2006, she moved into the house of anIslingtonLabour Councillor to experience life on acouncil estate, her response to her experience being "Five years ago I made a speech in the House of Commons about the forgotten decents. I have spent the last week on estates in the Islington area finding out that they are still forgotten."cite webAnne gets taste of council estate life22 November 200628 November 2006Islington Gazettehttp://www.islingtongazette.co.uk/content/islington/gazette/news/story.aspx?brand

In January 2011 Widdecombe was joint President of theNorth of England Education ConferenceinBlackpool. She shared the responsibility with a young person from the town.neec2011She has also become a patron of The Grace Charity for M.E.cite webhttp://www.thegracecharityforme.org/Welcome to the Grace Charity for M.E.The Grace Charity for M.E.21 November 2010http://web.archive.org/web/20101030151852/http://www.thegracecharityforme.org/30 October 2010no

Widdecombe revealed, in an April 2012 interview with Matt Chorley ofThe Independent, that she was writing her autobiography, which she described as ".. rude about all and sundry, but an amount of truth is always necessary."

Widdecombe is a Patron of the charitySafe Haven for Donkeys in the Holy Land(SHADH) and in 2014 visited the SHADH Donkey Sanctuary inWest BankPalestine.cite webhttp://goodnewsshared.com/safe-life-ann-widdecombe-visits-donkey-charity/Safe For Life: Ann Widdecombe Visits Donkey CharityGood News Shared
